They want to know what kind of videos are working in their space.

5-7 competitor channels daily. Document view counts and

It works.

But yikes. That’s a lot of time.

Every morning at 6am, you get an email showing exactly which

subject: Answering 4 advanced automation questions
body:
Last week during our Make Money With Make group call, four
members asked questions that I think could change how you think
about your automation business.

These aren’t your typical “how do I find clients?” questions.

These are the questions people ask when they’re already making
money but want to scale smarter.

I’m sharing them with you today because these answers apply
whether you’re just starting or already doing $10k+/month.

Let’s dive in.

---------------------------------------------------------
Question 1: “My solution just became obsolete. What now?”
---------------------------------------------------------

The situation: John (name changed) spent 8 months building an AI
copilot for Klaviyo agencies. Then Klaviyo launched their own AI
agent that does basically the same thing.

Brutal.

My answer: Stop building massive orchestrated systems. Build lots
of tiny, hyperspecific solutions instead.

Technology moves so fast that if you spend 8 months perfecting
one big system, it’ll likely be obsolete before you finish.

The optimal play is to build 10 small solutions in that same
timeframe. Test all of them. Identify which one solves the
biggest constraint. Then spend your time selling that one, not
building.

Most people do the opposite—they spend months building, then
wonder why nobody buys.

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Question 2: “How do I sell backend systems like CRM automations?”
-----------------------------------------------------------------

The situation: Tim (name changed as well—they’re all changed for
anonymity) wanted to know how to position and sell CRM
automations through cold email, specifically to agencies and real
estate brokerages.

My answer: Offer a templated CRM setup completely for free (or
extraordinarily cheap).

Hello,

It’s been a busy month with new features and quality-of-life improvements to Cursor!

*********
Plan Mode
*********

Plan Mode ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/planning#plan-mode ) does deep research into your codebase, reading files and asking clarifying questions to create a detailed plan before writing any code. You can review and refine the plan before handing it to Cursor to execute.

We’ve found that this allows agents to run for significantly longer.

**************
Slash Commands
**************

You can now create reusable prompts and quickly share them with your team. Commands ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/chat/commands ) are stored in .cursor/commands/[command].md. Run them by typing /  in the Agent input and selecting the command from the dropdown menu.

We’ve been using them for running linters, fixing compile errors, and creating PRs with detailed descriptions and conventional commits.

****************
Browser Controls
****************

Agent can control a web browser ( https://cursor.com/docs/agent/browser ) to test applications, audit accessibility, convert designs into code, and more. With full access to console logs and network traffic, Agent can debug issues and automate comprehensive testing workflows.

Start using with @Browser.

PR Summaries from Bugbot
************************

When creating a PR in GitHub, Bugbot ( https://cursor.com/bugbot ) will now generate a summary of the changes. The summary will be updated as you push changes so it's always up-to-date.

Let us know any feedback you have!
